edu.stanford.nlp.mt.train

Class AlignmentTemplates

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.util.AbstractCollection<AlignmentTemplate>
      • edu.stanford.nlp.mt.train.AlignmentTemplates
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Iterable<AlignmentTemplate>, Collection<AlignmentTemplate>

    public class AlignmentTemplates
extends AbstractCollection<AlignmentTemplate>
    AlignmentTemplates is a collection that maps between AlignmentTemplate instances and a contiguous non-negative integer index series beginning (inclusively) at 0. This class supports constant-time lookup in both directions (via get(int) and indexOf(AlignmentTemplate)). Note that get(int) is a relatively costly operation, since, due to memory constraints, AlignmentTemplate instances are not stored in the Collection (hence, an new instance of AlignmentTemplate is constructed on each call of get()).
    Author:
    Michel Galley
